column1: #Text=Professor Swyington Bumper seemed to live in a region all by himself .

#Text=Though he was on board the Bellaconda , he might just as well have been in an airship , or riding along on the back of a donkey , as far as his knowledge , or recognition , of his surroundings went .
#Text=He seemed to be thinking thoughts far , far away , and he was never without a book -- either a bound volume or a note-book .
#Text=In the former he buried his hawk-like nose , and Tom , looking over his shoulder once , saw that the book was printed in curious characters , which , later , he learned were Sanskrit .
#Text=If he had a note-book the bald-headed professor was continually jotting down memoranda in it .
#Text=" I can hardly think of him as a conspirator against us , " said Tom to Mr. Titus .
#Text=" After you have been in the contracting business as long as I have you 'll distrust every one , " was the answer .

#Text= Well , unless the bomb fell from some passing airship , I do n't see how it got on deck , " said Tom with a shake of his head .

column1: #Text=" And I 'm sure no airship passed over us .

#Text= You have , " said Tom , with a smile .

column1: #Text=" You saved our lives from a bomb the other day .

#Text=There have n't been any more bombs thrown at us ,  the contractor said .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Yes , I have been there , " admitted the bald-headed scientist in guarded tones .

column1: #Text=" Well , I am digging a tunnel in that vicinity , " went on Mr. Titus , " and if you ever get near Rimac , where the first cutting is made , I wish you would come and see me -- Tom too , as he is associated with me .

column3:

#Text= Rimac-Rimac , " murmured the professor , looking sharply at the contractor .

#Text= Why , the Peruvian government engaged me to do it to connect the two railroad lines , " was the answer .

column1: #Text=" Do you know anything about the place ?
